alert.note: Alert for Chester; Delaware; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 5:56PM EDT until May 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Chester, Delaware, Montgomery, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in parts of the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, West Chester, Norristown, Chester, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Yeadon, Westtown, and Downingtown. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 311 and 346. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 33. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 38. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
